title: 10 Reasons You Should Be Watching Apple TV+'s Hello Tomorrow!
description:
Created by Amit Bhalla and Lucas Jansen, Apple TV+’s Hello Tomorrow! stars Billy Crudup as a 1950s traveling salesman peddling “Brightside Lunar Residences”—an idyllic suburban condo community enclosed under a dome on the moon. But all is not what it seems on this excellent series, which just dropped its first three…

title: A New Dungeons & Dragons Movie Clip Works the Graveyard Shift
description:
With every single video that comes out for this film, I am more and more convinced that Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is just an amalgamation of the most common pitfalls in any given D&D campaign. Is it as funny watching it on screen as it is when you’re playing it out with friends? That remains to be seen.…

Read more...

title: Dynamic, Heartbreaking and NO ZOMBIES | The Last of Us Episode 6 Review
Matthew Modine Narrates a New UFO Documentary and We've Got the First Trailer
description:
A lot was happening in 2020 so there’s a chance you may have missed something—like the fact the New York Times published a story basically saying aliens are real. The claim was based on a document stating that the government has found unexplained objects that were “not made on this earth.” You read that right.

title: All the Questions We Have After Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania
description:
Phase Five is in full effect with the release of Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania. Paul Rudd’s third time around as former criminal turned Avenger Scott Lang sees him, his daughter Cassie (Kathryn Newton), and the whole Pym/Van Dyne family (Hope, Hank, and Janet, played by Evangeline Lilly, Michael Douglas, and…

title: This AI-Powered Robot Arm Collaborates With Humans to Create Unique Paintings
description:
A new AI robotic arm was created to paint compelling artwork and is now coming to the forefront as a revolutionary entity. FRIDA (Framework and Robotics Initiative for Developing Arts) is a robotic arm created at Carnegie Mellon University’s School of Computer Science and is the newest addition to the university’s art…

title: This Week's Toy News Goes to Hell-Diddly-Ell and Back
description:
Welcome back to Toy Aisle, io9's regular roundup of the latest toy news tickling our wallets. title: Unexpected Animals That Use Tools
description:
Scientists once thought that only humans and our closest relatives, chimps, were smart enough to use tools. But as our documenting of the natural world has gotten more detailed—and as we’ve become, perhaps, less haughty about our supposed superior intellect—we’ve found that many species are actually deft with sticks,…

title: Human Composting Is Changing the Landscape of Death Care—and It May Soon Be Legal Near You
description:
When Howard Fischer eventually dies, he is going to be composted in Seattle. He’ll be wrapped in cloth, placed on a bed of wood chips, and then his family will cover him in alfalfa and flowers. After a ceremony, his body will go into a hexagonal vessel with an internal structure similar to that of a honeycomb, where…

title: Photos: How Do You Translate Memes Into Live Stand-up?
description:
Instagram’s meme makers are taking their talents to a surprising place: the stage. But more so than the static images they post, their shows  resemble stand-up comedy.

title: How Embroidery, Piano, and French Lessons Made the First Computer Programmer
description:
Ada Lovelace, known as the first computer programmer, was born on Dec. 10, 1815, more than a century before digital electronic computers were developed.

title: Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey Shine in a Super Emotional Last of Us
description:
Down the road, if The Last of Us is lucky enough to get any acting award nominations, clips from this episode will explain why. The sixth episode of The Last of Us, titled “Kin,” saw Joel and Ellie’s trek across the United States reach a crossroads. The pair were forced to deal with things they’ve been hiding and make…
